description: used this for python as well with some plug-ins
I hate java, but the ide works as expected

Maven projects are not being updated, whether the update is forced or not.
Marketplace is in half broken state. I can install the plugins, but they don't seem to work, and can't be uninstalled either. And by trying to uninstall them, the marketplace just disappears afterwards, like it uninstalled itself altogether. In addition the plugins are not removed after the uninstall of the eclipse flatpak.

It may have it's bugs, but it feels a lot faster and lighter than IntelliJ IDEA, and while the language support could be better, you can install (mostly) free plugins to get around this.

It offers a traditional experience to code editing, but could do with a few more syntax highlighting themes.

I have tried other IDEs, but I always keep coming back to Eclipse due to it being one of the most sensible IDEs with good defaults. The debugging function is really good, with virtually no delay, even in a large-sized project. Code errors also show up quickly, but when making external changes you need to clean or rebuild the project.

I have not given this five stars as it could do with more theming capabilities, a better look-and-feel, and there are many bugs that meant I stuck to older versions until recently.

I installed the Eclipse Flatpak on Fedora 36. Then I went to Markplace and install Sprint Tool Suite. After rebooting Eclipse, Marketplace was missing from the help menu. I really wanted to use Eclipse Flatpak, but it seems a little bugy at this time. I need it to just work. I wanted to see it meet my needs before contributing $$$. I know it is an endless circle, you need money to make it better, but it needs to be better to get donations. I assume if one installs the Eclipse Flatpak and uses as is, it work fine. I wish the team all the best.
You must go to the Eclipse marketplace and uninstall and then reinstall both gradle and maven plugins since they come broken.
Excelent. It is all right: libs, jdk, jre, maven, addons, debuging, git integration, ssh, etc. Working pretty well... Sure you need to know what you are doing, then... Let's work!
Not sure if this is the apps fault so 3 stars ig
I downloaded this because I required it for a course. The marketplace, which I need access to for installing various plugins required by the text, crashes on every attempt to open.
I'm experiencing an issue in the Design View where components are overlapping, making it challenging to work with...
Font icons and all views completly buggish
